Article Title: Dubai-based siblings who own JioHotstar domain have this ‘take it or leave it’ offer for Team Reliance
Article Text:
How JioHotstar domain went to Dubai siblings

Here’s what they wrote on website

Hello, everyone! We hope you are doing well. Today, we want to share an important update about jiohotstar.com, a domain we bought some time ago. For those who don’t know, we bought this domain from a young developer in Delhi to help him with his education. This was part of our efforts to support and uplift others.

Recently, we received many emails from people wanting to buy the domain. To check if these offers were real, we reached out to some of them. We found that while some offers were fake, a few were serious and offered a lot of money. But even with these genuine offers, we never wanted to sell the domain. We made this clear by replying to everyone that the domain was not for sale.

Over the last few weeks, there has been a lot of talk and even some videos about why we own the domain and if it connects to a possible business deal between Jio and Hotstar. We want to clear up any confusion: we never expected this attention and never meant to cause any controversy. Our only goal was to support the developer and share our seva (service) journey.

With all the discussions happening, we now think it might be best for Team Reliance to have this domain, if they want it. We are happy to give jiohotstar.com to them for free, with all the proper paperwork. To be clear, this is entirely our choice. No one from Reliance or any legal group has contacted us or pressured us in any way. We made this decision on our own, without any pressure from friends, family, or anyone else.

If Reliance is interested, they can contact us at jainam@1xl.com or jivika@1xl.com, and we will handle the transfer smoothly. If they are not interested, that’s okay too. We will continue to share updates about our journey and work.

To all influencers and media, we ask for your help in spreading the word about SevakArmy.com, our mission to bring together volunteers. Our goal is simple but powerful: we want 100,000 people to volunteer just 20 hours a year. This would add up to 2 million hours of service in the first year—like having 1,000 people working full-time for a year to help NGOs. Imagine the positive impact we could make together!

Thank you for reading. We look forward to continuing our journey with all of you. Jai Jinendra!

From Jainam & Jivika

The saga of owning the JioHotstar .com domain just took an unexpected twist. Dubai siblings – Jainam and Jivika, who purchased it from a Delhi-based app developer have now said that they are willing to ‘give’ the domain to ‘Team Reliance ’ for free.Sharing an update on the website, the two wrote “With all the discussions happening, we now think it might be best for Team Reliance to have this domain, if they want it. We are happy to give jiohotstar.com to them for free, with all the proper paperwork.”The drama around the Jiohotstar.com domain unfolded last month when a Delhi-based app developer posted a letter publicly – asking the company to fund his higher studies in exchange for him giving up the domain for Rs 1 crore. "My intention of buying this domain was simple: if this merger happens, I might be able to fulfill my dream of studying at Cambridge," said the developer then.When Reliance declined his offer, the developer sold the domain to siblings from Dubai, UAE. The siblings say that their “only goal was to support the developer and share our seva (service) journey” and “that the domain was not for sale.”“Recently, we received many emails from people wanting to buy the domain. To check if these offers were real, we reached out to some of them. We found that while some offers were fake, a few were serious and offered a lot of money. But even with these genuine offers, we never wanted to sell the domain. We made this clear by replying to everyone that the domain was not for sale,” the duo said.
Article Summary: Dubai siblings – Jainam and Jivika, who purchased it from a Delhi-based app developer have now said that they are willing to 'give' the domain to ‘Team Reliance ’ for free. “With all the discussions happening, we now think it might be best for Team Reliance to have this domain, if they want it. We are happy to give jiohotstar.com to them for free, with all the proper paperwork,” they said.

Article Title: Booking.com may cut jobs, but company confirms no layoffs in these brands
Article Text:
Brands that are likely safe from job cuts

What Booking.com said in SEC filing

Expedia laid off 1,500 employees

Booking.com parent company Booking Holdings is reportedly considering job cuts in the online travel platform, The potential layoffs are said to be part of a comprehensive review of the company’s organisational structure.According to a report by news agency Reuters, “Online travel agency Booking.com could cut jobs as part of a review of its organizational structure.” The report quotes an emailed statement that said that the company is in the early stages of the review process and no firm decision has been made as yet.The changes reportedly come only days after Booking Holdings posted a 13.6% jump in operating expenses for the third quarter.While the company has warned of job cuts at Book.com, it did say that layoff will be limited to the online travel platform. A spokesperson of the company told Reuters that the ‘review’ is limited to Booking.com and does not affect other brands within the Booking Holdings portfolio, such as Priceline, Agoda, Kayak, and OpenTable.Why there may be job cuts at Booking.com"This is a difficult but necessary proactive step to make sure Booking.com remains agile in a very competitive industry and keeps driving customer-centered innovation at pace," the company said in the statement shared with Reuters.The specific details about the extent of the potential job cuts remain unclear. Booking Holdings' latest filing with the US Securities and Exchange Commission indicated that the company expects to provide more information about the timing, impact on employees, and financial implications of the reorganisation “in due course.”"We believe these efforts will improve operating expense efficiency, increase organizational agility, free up resources that can be reinvested into further improving our offering to both travelers and partners," it said in the filing.Earlier this year, online travel platform Expedia announced that it would cut 1,500 jobs globally, about 9% of its workforce as a part of organisational and technological transformation."The business continues to evaluate the appropriate allocation of resources to ensure the most important work continues to be prioritised," an Expedia Group spokesperson said at that time.
Article Summary: Booking.com parent company Booking Holdings is reportedly considering job cuts in the online travel platform. The potential layoffs are said to be part of a comprehensive review of the company’s organisational structure. The changes reportedly come only days after Booking. Holdings posted a 13.6% jump in operating expenses.

Article Title: Elon Musk just added to his fan following in India with these 'comments' on Canada PM Justin Trudeau
Article Text:
What Elon Musk wrote on Canada PM Justin Trudeau

Why many Indians will agree with his criticism of Canada PM Justin Trudeau

Tesla CEO Elon Musk may have just given a massive boost to his popularity in India. Reason is what can be termed as 'trolling' of Canada PM Justin Trudeau . In the past few days Elon Musk has replied to or quoted posts on X, formerly Twitter, that criticise Canada PM Trudeau.What makes his comments more important is the role he is likely to play in the US government after Donald Trump's return as the US President. Elon Musk played a very important part in US President-Elect Donald Trump's win. He campaigned extensively for him both online and offline, even participating in some road shows.A user going by the name 'Truthful' shared a graph on Twitter showing how Canada's GDP per capita has fallen under PM Trudeau with a "LOL" (laugh out loud) message on top. Elon Musk quoted the same message and wrote "Wow".Earlier this week, Tesla CEO had written that Justin Trudeau would lose his position as Canada's Prime Minister in the next election in response to a Twitter user's comment. Just a day after US elections results (November 7), a user on Twitter told Musk, “we need your help in Canada getting rid of Trudeau.” Responding to the post, Musk said, “He will be gone in the upcoming election.” TThe prediction comes as Trudeau prepares to face electoral challenges from Pierre Poilievre's Conservative Party and Jagmeet Singh's New Democratic Party.These comments are not the first time that Elon Musk has criticised the Canadian government. Earlier too he had expressed dismay over the approach to free speech, particularly regarding new regulations requiring online streaming services to register for government oversight.The diplomatic relations between India and Canada have deteriorated significantly under PM Justin Trudeau's government. India has expressed serious concerns about extremism and anti-India activities in Canada, urging Canadian authorities to address these issues.The relationship recently nosedived after Canadian officials claimed Indian government's hand in the death of Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar. This diplomatic tension has resulted in India withdrawing its High Commissioner from Canada. "The responsibility for the damage that this cavalier behaviour has caused to India-Canada relations lies with Prime Minister Trudeau alone," said foreign ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal in October after the Canadian PM alleged that he had "credible allegations" of India's involvement in Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar's killing.Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently also condemned the "deliberate attack" on a Hindu temple in Canada, expressing concern about the "cowardly attempts to intimidate" Indian diplomats. He stated that New Delhi expects Canadian authorities to ensure justice and maintain law and order.
Article Summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk may have just given a massive boost to his popularity in India. Reason is what can be termed as 'trolling' of Canada PM Justin Trudeau. In the past few days Elon Musk has replied to or quoted posts on X, formerly Twitter, that criticise PM Trudeau.

Article Title: Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath retain his youngest philanthropist title Hurun's list after Rs 120 crore donation to this cause
Article Text:
HCL founder Shiv Nadar tops Hurun India philanthropist list

Nikhil Kamath, the 38-year-old co-founder of Zerodha, has again retained his position as the youngest philanthropist in the Hurun India list this year as well. Zerodha co-founders Nikhil Kamath abd Nithin Kamath made it to 'Hurun’s top Philanthropist List 2023' after having donated Rs 110 crore to organisations dealing in climate change and environmental sustainability.Kamath's Rs 120 crore contribution to the Rainmatter Foundation has placed him among Hurun India list 2024. Along with his brother Nithin Kamath (45), Nikhil Kamath ranks at 15th on the list of philanthropists who donated over Rs 100 crore. In 2023, the Kamath brothers ranked at No. 12 in the list..Nikhil Kamath's philanthropic endeavors reportedly extend beyond India. He is the youngest Indian member of The Giving Pledge, a global initiative founded by billionaires Bill Gates and Warren Buffett. Additionally, he established the Young Indian Philanthropic Pledge (YIPP), which collaborates with startup leaders to commit at least 25% of their net worth to philanthropic causes.Other notable young philanthropists on the list include Adar Poonawalla (43) of the Villoo Poonawalla Charitable Foundation and Vivek Vakil (35) of Asian Paints. Poonawalla emerged as the highest contributor with Rs 142 crore among the youngest contributors.HCL Technologies’ founder Shiv Nadar once again emerged as India's most generous individual philanthropist, surpassing even the country's richest individuals. In FY24, Nadar's philanthropic contributions stood at Rs 2,153 crore, higher than the richest Indian Gautam Adani's Rs 330 crore and second richest Indian Mukesh Ambani of Reliance Industries' Rs 407 crore, as per the Edelgive-Hurun India Philanthropy List.Ambani has moved up one place to rank at No. 2 on the giving list, while Adani maintained his fifth position. The Bajaj family with interests in auto and finance has moved up three places with a 33 per cent growth in giving at Rs 352 crore, while Kumarmangalam Birla and family stands fourth on the list with Rs 334 crore in total donations, which were up 17 per cent over the year-ago period.In all, there were 203 individuals who donated more than Rs 5 crore. As per Hurun's rich list, there were 1,539 individuals having a networth of over Rs 1,000 crore each and their cumulative wealth shot up 46 per cent in the year.
Article Summary: HCL founder Shiv Nadar tops Hurun India philanthropist list. Nikhil Kamath, the 38-year-old co-founder of Zerodha, has again retained his position as the youngest philanthropist in the HurUn India list this year.

Article Title: Zomato has a new plan to stop food wastage, and how this ‘Flash Sale’ is good news for users
Article Text:
Zomato delivery personnel

Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal on ‘Food Rescue’ feature

Someone's cancelled order could be your lunch, dinner, or even snack—that too at a discount. Zomato has unveiled " Food Rescue ," an initiative that transforms abandoned orders into budget-friendly meals for nearby customers. The feature aims to address the staggering problem of food waste on the platform, where approximately 400,000 orders are cancelled monthly despite strict no-refund policies, says Zomato."Today, we are introducing Food Rescue," announced Zomato founder Deepinder Goyal on X (formerly Twitter). " Cancelled orders will now pop up for nearby customers, who can grab them at an unbeatable price, in their original untampered packaging, and receive them in just minutes."The system works by instantly notifying users within a 3-kilometer radius of a delivery partner carrying a cancelled order. To ensure food quality and safety , these notifications are time-sensitive, giving potential customers just minutes to claim the order before it's offered to others.The company has implemented several safeguards to maintain food quality and customer satisfaction. Temperature-sensitive items like ice creams, shakes, and smoothies are excluded from the program. The platform also respects dietary preferences, ensuring vegetarian customers only see vegetarian cancelled orders.Zomato says that the initiative has received overwhelming support from restaurant partners, with 99.9% opting to participate.The financial model creates a win-win scenario for everyone involved. When a cancelled order is rescued by a new customer, Zomato only keeps the tax amount while distributing the rest of the payment. The original customer gets reimbursed for their online payment, the restaurant earns twice—once from the cancelled order compensation and again from a portion of the rescue payment—and delivery partners receive full compensation for their entire journey, including both the original and redirected delivery.
Article Summary: Zomato's 'Food Rescue' feature turns abandoned orders into budget-friendly meals for nearby customers. The system works by instantly notifying users within a 3-kilometer radius of a delivery partner carrying a cancelled order. Zomato says that the initiative has received overwhelming support from restaurant partners.

Article Title: How two men looted Amazon of cameras, iPhones worth lakhs of rupees via a network spread across 8 states
Article Text:
Two men from Rajasthan, Raj Kumar Meena and Subhash Gurjar, were arrested in Mangaluru for allegedly defrauding Amazon of over ₹1 crore worth of electronics. The duo used fake identities and addresses to place orders, then swapped valuable items like cameras with fakes during delivery, exploiting loopholes in the system.

Here’s how they duped Amazon

How the two got arrested

Network spread across 8 states

Two men have been accused of scamming Amazon out of cameras, iPhones , and other expensive items worth lakhs of rupees. They allegedly tricked delivery partners to receive these valuable products without payment, reports Deccan Herald. Urwa police have reportedly arrested the duo, identified by Commissioner of Police Anupam Agrawal as Raj Kumar Meena (23) and Subhash Gurjar (27) from Rajasthan.As per the report, the duo ordered goods from Amazon worth Rs 11,45,000 using fake identities. These include two high-value Sony cameras and 10 other items.The scam started with the duo placing an order with Amazon under the false name ‘Amith’. They provided a fake address near KSRTC bus stand, Mangaluru and a fake contact number. Upon delivery of the items, one of them distracted the delivery executive, while the other discreetly swapped the labels on the boxes with those of other items in the order.Raj Kumar then provided an incorrect OTP, creating a delay in the delivery. Using the same tactic, he would tell the delivery executive that they would pick up the order the next day. The delivery executive, clueless of the switch, would unknowingly leave with incorrect items from the 12-item order.Next day, the duo would cancel the order, retaining the original items with them.Amazon’s delivery partner Mahindra Logistics got suspicious of the stickers and reported it to Amazon. Consequently, a probe was launched which found that the accused had replaced original Sony cameras with fake items.An investigation by Urwa Police then identified their pattern and were caught while trying to leave the city.One of the accused Raj Kumar Meena has previously been arrested in a similar fraud case that involved a camera order from Amazon on October 4. The Urwa police took him to custody on October 18.Police believe that the accused may be involved in defrauding e-commerce platforms of goods worth over Rs 1.29 crore, including fraud orders of cameras and iPhones. There are 11 cases against the duo that are registered in different states – Assam, Odisha, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Telangana, Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh, and Kerala.
Article Summary: Two men from Rajasthan, Raj Kumar Meena and Subhash Gurjar, were arrested in Mangaluru for allegedly defrauding Amazon of over ₹1 crore worth of electronics. The duo used fake identities and addresses to place orders, then swapped valuable items like cameras with fakes during delivery.

Article Title: Government to Amazon and Elon Musk's Starlink: Your satellite application can be processed only after ...
Article Text:
Strict security guidelines and declaration

Why government is extra cautious on security

The Department of Telecommunications ( DoT ) has reportedly imposed stringent security requirements on Elon Musk 's Starlink and Jeff Bezos's Amazon before approving their satellite communication services in India. According to a report in Economic Times, both companies are expected to provide detailed compliance information regarding data security, coverage area, and other key parameters.While Bharti-backed OneWeb and Reliance Jio 's partnership with SES have already secured approval, Starlink and Amazon's applications are still pending due to the additional security checks.Officials aware of the details told ET that letters to both the US-based firms were sent recently and the department is awaiting their reply. "Their applications can be processed only after they submit the compliance. The firms have so far not replied," said a person familiar with the details.Another official said that the government will wait for some more time for their reply, but the applications won't be processed till they agree to all the security conditions. "There are various security-related compliances as well as those related to data, coverage area etc which satcom providers have to give to the government in order to offer services in India. All the boxes need to be ticked," said a third official.As per security requirements, the terminals have to stop communicating if there is a change in latitude and longitude position in order to prevent any misuse. In its replies to the government, Starlink had reportedly given a declaration that none of its investors were from countries sharing a land border with India -- primarily China and Pakistan. The government had accepted that declaration.The government's cautious approach is driven by concerns over potential security risks, especially given the strategic importance of satellite communications. The DoT is particularly interested in ensuring that satellite terminals near border areas are securely monitored and controlled to prevent unauthorized access or misuse.The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is currently working on recommendations for pricing and other terms and conditions for allocating satellite spectrum. However, traditional telecom operators like Bharti Airtel, Reliance Jio, and Vodafone Idea are advocating for a level playing field, arguing that satellite companies should be subject to the same regulations and liabilities as terrestrial operators.
Article Summary: The Department of Telecommunications ( DoT) has reportedly imposed stringent security requirements on Elon Musk's Starlink and Jeff Bezos's Amazon. The government's cautious approach is driven by concerns over potential security risks. The DoT is particularly interested in ensuring that satellite terminals near border areas are securely monitored and controlled.

Article Title: Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy recalls when his daughter asked him to “hire a private plane…”
Article Text:

Narayana Murthy, co-founder of Infosys, and his wife, Sudha Murthy, recently shared some insights from their lives. As I was getting in the car, she asked again, ‘Think of anything special today?’ I still didn’t realize.”Later that day, while heading to Mumbai, Murthy received a call from their daughter, Akshata Murty, who was studying at Stanford University at the time. She immediately said, ‘Cancel it, get the first flight back to Bangalore, and wish your wife a happy anniversary!’”Narayana Murthy shared that he told her about a speech at 3pm but Akshata insisted, “I don’t care if you have a speech at 3 pm. If you need to hire a private plane, hire it, but come back and wish her!” Their daughter, Akshata Murty, is now married to former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak.Sudha Murthy also chimed in, laughing, “It was our 25th wedding anniversary so it doesn’t happen every year. So I thought, let me give him a cue but it did not work… For five-ten minutes I felt bad because I’m also human. Article Title: Indian-origin founders of this US-based company charged in H-1B visa fraud
Article Text:
Representative photo

Name of the US-based IT company charged

How the H-1B visa fraud happened

Timeline of the sentencing

What is H-1B visa programme

Kishore Dattapuram pleaded guilty in federal court this week to H-1B visa fraud and conspiracy to commit visa fraud. According to a press release US Attorney's Office, Northern District of California, Dattapuram, 55, of Santa Clara, and two other defendants, Kumar Aswapathi , 55, of Austin, Tex., and Santosh Giri , 48, of San Jose, were each charged in an indictment filed February 28, 2019, with one count of conspiracy to commit H-1B visa fraud and 10 counts of substantive visa fraud. Aswapathi pleaded guilty to all counts on October 19, 2020. Giri pleaded guilty to all counts on October 28, 2024.Dattapuram and Aswapathi owned Nanosemantics Inc , a staffing company headquartered in San Jose that provided skilled employees to technology companies in the Bay Area. Under its agreements with the companies and the employees it placed, Nanosemantics received a commission for workers placed at client companies. Giri worked closely with Nanosemantics and was also the owner of a separate business, LexGiri, a legal process outsourcing firm that served as a “remote-virtual corporate immigration specialist” for companies.In connection with its staffing work, Nanosemantics regularly submitted H-1B petitions for foreign workers.In pleading guilty, Dattapuram admitted to working with Aswapathi and Giri to submit fraudulent H-1B applications that falsely represented that foreign workers had specific jobs waiting for them at designated end-client companies when in fact the jobs did not exist. On multiple occasions, Dattapuram paid companies to be listed as end-clients for the foreign workers, even though he knew the workers would never work for those employers. As defendants admitted, the goal of the scheme was to allow Nanosemantics to obtain visas for job candidates before securing jobs for them, thereby allowing Nanosemantics to place those workers with employers as soon as those jobs were available, rather than waiting for the visa application process to conclude, and giving Nanosemantics an unfair advantage over its competitors.Dattapuram’s sentencing hearing is scheduled for February 24, 2025. Giri’s sentencing hearing is also scheduled for the same day. Aswapathi has a status regarding sentencing on November 25, 2024. Each defendant faces a maximum sentence of 10 years in prison and a fine of $250,000 for each visa fraud count, and a maximum sentence of five years in prison and a fine of $250,000 on the conspiracy count.The H-1B visa programme allows foreign workers to obtain temporary authorization to live and work for companies in the United States. In order to secure an H-1B visa, an employer or other sponsor must submit a Form I-129 petition to the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS). A petition and associated documentation must confirm the existence and duration of the job waiting for the worker, and describe key details including the wages associated with the position.
Article Summary: Kishore Dattapuram pleaded guilty in federal court this week to H-1B visa fraud and conspiracy to commit visa fraud. He and two other defendants, Kumar Aswapathi and Santosh Giri, were each charged in an indictment filed February 28, 2019, with one count of conspiracy. DattAPuram’s sentencing hearing is scheduled for February 24, 2025. Giri's sentencing hearing has been scheduled for November 25, 2024.

Article Title: AI humanoid robot's Alan Turing painting sells for $1 million at auction
Article Text:
How Ai-Da created this artwork



An artwork created by an AI-powered humanoid robot has sold for a record $1.08 million at a Sotheby's auction in New York. The painting, a 2.2-metre (7.5-foot) portrait of British computer scientist Alan Turing, surpassed its pre-auction estimate of $120,000-$180,000. It attracted 27 bids before being sold to an anonymous buyer.The artwork named “AI God: Portrait of Alan Turing,” was created by Ai-Da, a humanoid robot artist developed by Aidan Meller. Ai-Da uses AI algorithms and a robotic arm to create paintings, sculptures, and other forms of art.The painting's subject, Alan Turing, was a computer scientist who helped decrypt German codes during World War II but tragically died by suicide after facing persecution for his homosexuality. Meller hopes Ai-Da's work will spark reflection on the future of AI and its impact on humanity.Ai-Da, the humanoid robot artist, was brought to life in 2019 through a collaboration between Meller and a robotics company in Cornwall, UK.In a statement to CNN, Meller said that before starting a project, Ai-Da engages in discussions with its creators, expressing its preferences and ideas for the piece it wants to create.“In this instance, we had a discussion with her about ‘A.I. for good’ which led to Ai-Da bringing up Alan Turing as a key person in the history of A.I. that she wanted to paint,” Meller noted.Ai-Da's creation of the Alan Turing portrait involved a multi-stage process combining AI, robotics, and artistic decision-making. After discussing the painting's style and concept with its creators, Ai-Da used its camera eyes to analyze a photo of Turing and generate preliminary sketches.The robot then painted 15 individual portraits of Turing's face, each unique due to the AI algorithm's interpretation of the photo. Each painting took 6-8 hours to complete. Ai-Da then selected three of these portraits, along with a painting of Turing's Bombe Machine, to be combined into the final artwork.Due to the limited size of Ai-Da's canvas, the final image was printed onto a larger canvas using a 3D textured printer, preserving the original artwork's details. This process reflects the evolving capabilities of Ai-Da, whose agency and technology are constantly being refined.
Article Summary: Ai-Da, a humanoid robot artist, created a portrait of British computer scientist Alan Turing. The painting sold for a record $1.08 million at a Sotheby's auction in New York. Ai-Da uses AI algorithms and a robotic arm to create paintings, sculptures, and other forms of art.

Article Title: 'Qubool Hai, Qubool Hai, Qubool Hai': From Turkiye to Himachal Pradesh on video call
Article Text:
How the couple got married on a video call



Virtual marriages via video calls in the past



A couple in Himachal Pradesh got married virtually, on a video call. With the groom participating from Turkiye and the bride in Mandi, the unique ceremony was necessitated by the groom's inability to secure leave from his company and the bride's grandfather's wish for an immediate wedding.According to a report by the news agency PTI, the company in Turkiye where Adnan Muhammad (the groom) works denied his leave request. With the bride's ailing grandfather's desire for the wedding to proceed, the families agreed to a virtual "nikah" ceremony.The groom's family travelled from Bilaspur to Mandi, where the bride resided. The couple connected via video call, and a qazi performed the rituals, with the couple exchanging vows saying "qubool hai" thrice remotely.Akram Mohammad, the uncle of the bride, said the wedding was made possible only due to the advanced technology.A similar incident occurred last year when a couple in Himachal Pradesh, Ashish Singha from Kotgarh in Shimla and Shivani Thakur from Bhuntar, had a virtual wedding due to landslides preventing the groom's family from reaching the venue.During the Covid-19 pandemic, a couple in Kerala, Vignesh KM and Anjali Ranjith also opted for this unique solution to tie the knot: a virtual wedding ceremony conducted over Zoom.They even designed an e-invitation with a Zoom ID and password for guests to attend remotely. The ceremony took place at the groom's residence, and afterwards, his parents sent the mangalsutra and wedding attire to the bride via speed post.
Article Summary: A couple in Himachal Pradesh got married virtually, on a video call. The unique ceremony was necessitated by the groom's inability to secure leave from his company and the bride's grandfather's wish for an immediate wedding. The groom's family travelled from Bilaspur to Mandi, where the bride resided.

Article Title: TCS cuts variable pay of senior staff for July-September quarter: What the company has to say
Article Text:
How TCS pays variables to staff

What the company has to say

Tata Consultancy Services ( TCS ) has reduced variable pay for some employees in the July-September quarter, a report has said, adding that the cuts have hit even those who have complied with the company's work-from-office policy.Citing sources close to the matter, Moneycontrol reported that while some employees received only 20-40% of their quarterly variable pay, others received no variable pay at all. This marks a significant drop from the 70% payout in the previous quarter.In April 2024, TCS revised its attendance policy, mandating a minimum of 85% office attendance for employees to receive their full variable pay. Employees with lower attendance rates receive a reduced percentage of their variable pay, with those below 60% ineligible for the bonus.TCS links variable pay to office attendance as well as it also depends on the performance of individual business units. The report also said that the recent cuts reflect the challenging demand environment and economic uncertainties that have led to slower growth for major IT services companies in the second quarter.In Q2, India's largest IT services company reported a 5.5% year-on-year revenue growth in constant currency terms.“We expect the headwinds to stabilise in Q3 and return to growth in Q4,” the company told analysts in its post-earnings call last month.A TCS spokesperson clarified that junior-level employees received 100% of their quarterly variable allowance (QVA). However, for other grades, the QVA is based on their unit's business performance, consistent with the company's usual practice.“For Q2FY25 we have paid out 100% QVA to junior grades across the company. For all other grades, the QVA depends on their unit’s business performance. This is in line with our standard practice across quarters,” a TCS spokesperson was quoted as saying.
Article Summary: Tata Consultancy Services ( TCS ) has reduced variable pay for some employees in the July-September quarter. Cuts have hit even those who have complied with the company's work-from-office policy. In April 2024, TCS revised its attendance policy, mandating a minimum of 85% office attendance.

Article Title: Elon Musk joins Donald Trump on his 25-minute phone call with Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, and why it matters
Article Text: Elon Musk participated in US President-elect Donald Trump 's congratulatory call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Wednesday, signalling the tech billionaire's growing influence in Trump's incoming administration, according to Axios.During the 25-minute call, Musk assured Zelenskyy that Ukraine would continue receiving support through his Starlink satellite network, which has been crucial for Ukraine's military communications throughout the war with Russia, Axios reported.The call marked Trump's first contact with Zelenskyy since winning the presidential election. Sources briefed on the conversation told Axios that while specific policy details weren't discussed, the Ukrainian president found the timing of the call encouraging and was not left feeling anxious about Trump's victory.Musk's presence on the high-level diplomatic call follows reports of his substantial campaign contribution of $119 million to Trump and speculation about a potential cabinet position in the upcoming administration.The SpaceX CEO was also present during Trump's call with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, where it was revealed the two were having dinner together.Despite Trump's campaign promises to quickly broker peace between Russia and Ukraine, sources say the president-elect did not delve into specific plans during Wednesday's call. Zelenskyy later acknowledged in Budapest that while Trump desires a swift end to the conflict, they hadn't discussed detailed proposals.The relationship between Musk and Ukraine has been complex, with the tech entrepreneur previously drawing criticism for mocking Ukraine's requests for aid and proposing his own peace plan in 2022. However, his Starlink technology remains vital to Ukraine's war effort.The billionaire's involvement in high-level diplomacy comes as The Wall Street Journal revealed his regular communications with Russian President Vladimir Putin since late 2022. Trump has yet to speak with Russian President Vladimir Putin since the election, though Putin has indicated he would accept a call from the president-elect.
Article Summary: Musk assured Zelenskyy that Ukraine would continue receiving support through his Starlink satellite network. The SpaceX CEO was also present during Trump's call with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, where it was revealed the two were having dinner together. Trump has yet to speak with Russian President Vladimir Putin since the election.

Article Title: Onix unveils Kingfisher and Phoenix solutions to solve data challenges, accelerate AI adoption
Article Text:
How Onix’s news solutions will help AI adoption

How Kingfisher and Phoenix work

Onix has launched two AI-powered products aimed at solving the data-related challenges that large tech companies are currently facing. These include data scarcity, privacy concerns and the complexities of AI implementation.The cloud-native IT company that provides services in data, cloud and AI solutions modernisation has unveiled Kingfisher , a synthetic data generator, and Phoenix, an AI-powered business intelligence framework. The latest solutions join its Birds product suite aimed at streamlining AI-powered business intelligence.During a conversation with journalists on the sidelines of Onix's inaugural Annual Day, company CEO Sanjay Singh along with CTO Niraj Kumar talked about tech companies' reliance on AI for growth has skyrocketed the demand for high-quality, compliant data.They noted that as organisations struggle to navigate the complexities of deploying and managing AI systems effectively, Onix's Kingfisher and Phoenix tackle these challenges, providing businesses with powerful tools to unlock the full potential of AI.“Kingfisher and Phoenix aren’t just products—they’re transformative solutions that enable enterprises to innovate at scale with absolute confidence in data privacy and efficiency,” said Singh, adding that the solutions provide privacy.As per Kumar, Kingfisher addresses the need for secure and privacy-compliant data by generating synthetic data that mirrors the characteristics of real data without compromising sensitive information. He explained that this AI-powered solution analyses production code and identifies edge cases to create comprehensive datasets that are statistically identical to real data, enabling risk-free development, testing, and AI/ML model training.After the synthetic data is created, Phoenix simplifies the process of extracting meaningful insights from data, and by leveraging AI-powered automation, Phoenix enables real-time, conversational data querying and delivers intuitive, explainable insights.When asked how Onix’s approach is different from other tech giants, Singh explained that the company differentiates itself in the industry by leveraging AI and data modernisation. He highlighted their unique approach to data migration and integration, focusing on building a contextual understanding of the data landscape to enable AI-driven solutions.As per Kumar, while Kingfisher solves scarcity issues while protecting sensitive information ethically, Phoenix simplifies AI deployment, enabling enterprises to harness powerful models without the usual complexities.When asked about bias and privacy about the generated synthetic data, Kumar told The Times of India Tech that “the notion of synthetic data generation is to take care of the ethical area.”“Otherwise what will happen? It will expose all real data to the users even though you have used it for training purposes. Hence, all the access privileges are defined, so we protect the data and implement all policies, privileges and roles, and the user groups accordingly,” he explained.For example, even if an AI chatbot is trained on data related to credit card numbers, when asked through LLM or natural language, it will only give users the answer if you have privileged access to it. Otherwise, it will say, “I'm not able to give because you don't have access to it”.
Article Summary: Onix has launched two AI-powered products aimed at solving the data-related challenges that large tech companies are currently facing. These include data scarcity, privacy concerns and the complexities of AI implementation. The cloud- native IT company that provides services in data, cloud and AI solutions modernisation has unveiled Kingfisher and Phoenix.

Nvidia's stock soared to new heights, taking the chipmaker to a historic milestone. Article Title: Google’s Project Jarvis leaked on Chrome Web Store: How this AI agent can take over web browsing
Article Text:
What is Google’s Project Jarvis



Google’s experimental AI assistant, codenamed "Jarvis," has been reportedly leaked to the public through the Chrome Web Store. According to a report by The Information, the Chrome Web Store page for Jarvis describes it as a "helpful companion that surfs the web for you." The prototype was briefly available on the Chrome Web Store before being taken down by the company. While the leaked version was not fully functional, its description hinted at advanced capabilities like web browsing and task automation.Google is planning to reveal Jarvis in December. The AI assistant is expected to compete with rivals like Anthropic's Claude, which can perform complex tasks such as typing text and controlling a computer's cursor. While Google has not officially announced Jarvis, its accidental appearance on the Chrome Web Store offers a glimpse into the company's ongoing AI development efforts. It remains to be seen when or if Jarvis will be officially released to the public.This AI prototype goes beyond basic tasks like setting reminders or checking the weather, offering more advanced capabilities like browsing the web and completing tasks such as buying groceries, booking flights, and conducting research. This suggests a more sophisticated level of AI assistance than what is currently available in mainstream virtual assistants.Jarvis is designed to streamline web-based tasks by integrating with the Chrome browser. It can analyse web pages, interpret user instructions, and perform actions like clicking buttons and typing text, though its speed is currently being optimised.Jarvis joins a growing field of AI-powered automation tools being developed by tech giants like Microsoft (Copilot Vision), Apple (Apple Intelligence), Anthropic (Claude), and OpenAI (ChatGPT). These tools aim to simplify digital tasks and enhance productivity through natural language interaction and automated actions.While Jarvis shows promise in its ability to automate web-based tasks, its final form and public availability remain uncertain. As AI technology advances, we can expect more sophisticated tools that will transform our digital interactions and workflows.
Article Summary: Google's experimental AI assistant, codenamed "Jarvis," has been leaked to the public. The prototype was briefly available on the Chrome Web Store before being taken down. Jarvis is designed to streamline web-based tasks by integrating with the Chrome browser. It can analyse web pages, interpret user instructions, and perform actions like clicking buttons and typing text.

Article Title: Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos: Two 'most-popular' drama series on Netflix India in fiscal 2024 were ...

Most popular drama series and movies on Netflix India in fiscal 2024

Netflix India , the streaming giant's local subsidiary, has reported a 49% increase in net profit to Rs 52 crore for the fiscal year ending March 2024. This growth was fueled by a 29% rise in gross revenue to Rs 2,845 crore, driven by a growing subscriber base and the successful launch of mobile-specific plans. Netflix India’s gross turnover rose 29% to Rs 2,845 crore from Rs 2,214 crore in FY23, boosted by a growing subscriber base, show its financial data sourced by business intelligence platform Tofler.During the company's recent earnings calls, global executives highlighted India as a key market for subscriber growth and revenue. During the third-quarter earnings call, Co-CEO Greg Peters said that markets like India exemplified Netflix’s decade-long investment in local creative communities, partnering with storytellers to help them deliver compelling narratives to audiences.During Netflix's second-quarter earnings call, the company highlighted India as the second-largest market globally for paid net subscriber additions in the June-ended quarter and third in revenue percentage growth.With an estimated 12 million subscribers, Netflix, according to Media Partners Asia, is said to be India's largest pure-play streaming service. This strong performance follows months of subscriber growth attributed to the introduction of a cheaper ad-supported plan and the crackdown on password sharing.
Article Summary: Netflix India reported a 49% increase in net profit to Rs 52 crore for the fiscal year ending March 2024. This growth was fueled by a 29% rise in gross revenue to Rs 2,845 crore. Netflix surpassed Wall Street's expectations for both earnings and revenue in its latest quarterly report.

Article Title: Zomato and Swiggy are allegedly violating India’s competition law, here’s what the complaints are
Article Text:
What CCI investigation found out

Food delivery platforms Zomato and SoftBank-backed Swiggy have allegedly violated competition laws. India's antitrust watchdog, the Competition Commission of India (CCI), has reportedly discovered that Zomato and Swiggy engaged in practices that violate competition laws. According to a report by the news agency Reuters, documents have revealed that business practices of these popular food delivery platforms favour select restaurants listed on their platforms. The report cited some documents prepared by the CCI (which are not available to the public) to claim that Zomato offered lower commissions to restaurants that signed exclusivity agreements, while Swiggy guaranteed business growth to certain restaurants that listed exclusively on its platform. These practices are seen as anti-competitive and potentially harmful to smaller restaurants and consumers. The CCI's findings could lead to penalties and corrective measures for both Zomato and Swiggy.The investigation launched in 2022 reportedly started after a complaint by the National Restaurant Association of India. This complaint highlighted the impact on food outlets of the alleged anti-competitive practices of Swiggy and Zomato.While the CCI report remains confidential, its findings were shared with Zomato, Swiggy, and the National Restaurant Association of India, which filed the initial complaint.Zomato's shares fell 3% following the report. The CCI case is also listed as an “internal risk” in Swiggy's IPO prospectus, highlighting the potential for substantial penalties. The report also noted that Swiggy plans to launch a program similar to its discontinued " Swiggy Exclusive " (Swiggy Grow) in non-metropolitan cities, raising further concerns about potential anti-competitive practices.The CCI also reportedly found that Zomato imposed pricing and discount restrictions on restaurant partners, while Swiggy threatened to lower the rankings of restaurants that did not maintain price parity.The CCI is currently reviewing the investigation's findings and will make a final decision on any penalties or required changes to Zomato and Swiggy's business practices.
Article Summary: India's antitrust watchdog, the Competition Commission of India (CCI), has reportedly discovered that Zomato and Swiggy engaged in practices that violate competition laws. The investigation launched in 2022 reportedly started after a complaint by the National Restaurant Association of India. The CCI's findings could lead to penalties and corrective measures.

Article Title: How worried China and Taiwan's chip industries are preparing for Donald Trump’s return to White House
Article Text:
China races to stockpile chip equipment

Taiwan's semiconductor sector on edge

CHIPS Act future remains uncertain

China's semiconductor industry is gearing up for Donald Trump 's return to the White House by accelerating equipment purchases and exploring new talent recruitment strategies, according to industry experts and documents reviewed by Reuters.The aggressive preparation comes as Trump, who previously targeted Chinese tech giants Huawei and SMIC with trade restrictions, is expected to take an even tougher stance on China's chip ambitions in his second term. Industry experts told Reuters that Chinese firms are significantly better prepared this time, having learned crucial lessons from Trump's first presidency.Chinese manufacturers have particularly focused on acquiring lithography machines, with imports surging 35.44% to $7.9 billion in the first nine months of 2023, Chinese customs data reveals. The majority of these machines came from the Netherlands, valued at $7 billion, before new restrictions took effect.Companies have maximised equipment orders to hedge against future restrictions. Chinese chip maker Jinan Lujing Semiconductor Co's emphasis on self-reliance echoes a broader industry sentiment, noting that Trump's first term had already highlighted "the necessity of localization.""Chinese tech companies have progressively expanded their production capacities to mitigate future risks," Nori Chiou, investment director at Singapore-based White Oak Capital Partners, told Reuters.The Beijing Semiconductor Industry Association is advising companies to seize potential opportunities if global coordination on chip sanctions weakens under Trump. "There could be benefits to China's semiconductor industry in terms of professional talents, multinational companies and foreign cooperation," said Zhu Jing, the association's deputy secretary-general, in a WeChat post.The situation has created ripples in Taiwan, where semiconductor giant TSMC faces uncertainty about its global operations. Despite growing concerns, Taiwan's leader William Lai Ching-te projected confidence on Wednesday, stating that "the long-standing Taiwan-US partnership, based on shared values and interests, will continue to serve as a cornerstone of regional stability."However, Trump's recent comments have stirred anxiety in Taiwan's chip sector. During an October appearance on The Joe Rogan Experience podcast, Trump accused Taiwan of "stealing" the US chip industry, questioning the island's role in global semiconductor supply chains. His former national security adviser John Bolton notably warned that under a second Trump term, "Taiwan is potentially toast."Despite these tensions, TSMC has affirmed its commitment to its US investments. The world's largest contract chipmaker announced it would continue with its $65 billion investment plan for new factories in Arizona, regardless of Trump's election victory.TSMC has notified Chinese chip design companies that it will suspend production of their most advanced AI chips starting Monday, according to the Financial Times. The world's largest contract chipmaker will no longer manufacture AI chips at advanced process nodes of 7 nanometres or smaller for Chinese customers, with future supplies subject to Washington's approval.According to CNBC, despite Trump's campaign rhetoric against the CHIPS Act, policy experts believe the $53 billion semiconductor initiative will likely remain largely intact, though with possible modifications to fund allocation.While policy experts anticipate the CHIPS Act will survive Trump's return, the semiconductor industry's landscape remains in flux. As both Chinese and Taiwanese chip sectors brace for potential policy shifts, the $53 billion US semiconductor initiative stands as a critical factor in shaping the industry's global future, despite lingering uncertainty about Trump's trade policies.
Article Summary: China's semiconductor industry is gearing up for Donald Trump's return to the White House by accelerating equipment purchases. Trump is expected to take an even tougher stance on China's chip ambitions in his second term. The situation has created ripples in Taiwan, where semiconductor giant TSMC faces uncertainty about its global operations.

Article Title: TikTok ban: From US to Canada here’s a list of countries that have banned TikTok
Article Text:
List of countries where TikTok is banned

Afghanistan: The Taliban banned TikTok in April 2022, citing its “misleading” influence on the country’s youth. The move aligns with Afghanistan’s restrictive cultural policies, where the government exercises strict control over media and content to enforce its societal norms.

Armenia and Azerbaijan: During periods of military tension, including recent border clashes, these two countries have temporarily blocked TikTok. Azerbaijan lifted its most recent ban in October 2023. The temporary bans reflect concerns that the app could be misused for spreading information or propaganda during conflicts.

Australia: TikTok has been banned on government devices in Australia since April 2023. However, the general public can still access and use the app, suggesting that Australia’s primary concern lies in protecting sensitive government data.

Austria, Denmark, and the European Union: Several European nations, including Austria and Denmark, as well as institutions within the European Union, have restricted TikTok on government-issued devices. European security agencies are concerned about the possibility of foreign access to user data, especially with China’s growing influence in technology.

India: India enacted a comprehensive ban on TikTok in 2020 after a deadly border clash with China. The government cited national security as the reason, marking one of the first full-scale bans on the app worldwide. Indian content creators, previously very active on TikTok, moved to other platforms such as YouTube Shorts and Instagram Reels to maintain their audiences.

Indonesia: In October 2023, Indonesia banned TikTok’s “Shop” feature, citing violations of local e-commerce regulations. The country’s selective restriction is an example of how governments may choose to regulate specific functionalities of an app to align with local laws, rather than banning it outright.

Iran and Pakistan: Both countries have intermittently blocked TikTok, often citing social, moral, or ethical concerns. Iran has long restricted internet access to global platforms, including TikTok, as part of broader controls on content that conflicts with its government’s values.

United States: Congress and the U.S. military have barred TikTok from all government devices, and around half of U.S. states have adopted similar restrictions for state-owned devices. The primary concern in the U.S. is foreign access to personal data, as there are fears that the Chinese government could exploit user information for intelligence purposes.

Russia: Although TikTok is still accessible in Russia, users are mainly shown content generated within the country. This restriction reflects Russia’s increasing control over online information and its efforts to limit foreign influence on Russian users.

Other countries: Numerous other nations have enacted restrictions based on their unique concerns. For example, Jordan banned TikTok following civil unrest in December 2022, citing concerns over its use to spread misinformation. In Nepal, a ban was issued in November 2023, and Somalia has also blocked TikTok over concerns about its role in spreading propaganda and extremist content.

Canada has recently issued a directive to close TikTok’s offices in Toronto and Vancouver, citing increasing concerns over data privacy and potential foreign influence, specifically in relation to the app’s Chinese ownership. This action reflects a serious response to perceived risks associated with TikTok’s data collection and sharing practices, which have been scrutinised in Canada and internationally. The announcement, made by Canadian officials on Wednesday, underscores the government’s belief that TikTok poses a security threat due to the potential misuse of user data and the influence that foreign entities could exert through the platform.As more countries seek to protect their citizens’ information and limit potential foreign influence, TikTok’s operations and global reach may be further impacted, influencing both the app’s future growth and the broader conversation around data security and privacy on social media platforms.Canada’s move aligns with a growing international trend where countries are imposing bans, restrictions, or partial limitations on TikTok, typically because of privacy concerns, national security, or ethical reasons. Here’s a detailed overview of the actions taken by various countries:Across these regions, governments share common concerns around data privacy, national security, and the platform’s influence on social behaviour. Many governments worry that TikTok’s data-gathering techniques allow it to collect extensive personal information, which could be accessed by foreign entities. Additionally, with TikTok’s growing popularity, there’s a fear of the app being used to shape public opinion, especially in politically sensitive regions. For instance, during conflicts, TikTok could theoretically be leveraged to disseminate propaganda or influence public perception.

India enacted a comprehensive ban on TikTok after a deadly border clash with China in 2020. The U.S. military and Congress have barred TikTok from all government devices. Many European nations, including Austria and Denmark, have restricted TikTok on government-issued devices.
